author: .fjl
content: The Discovery v5.2 protocol version development cycle starts today

author: .fjl
content:
At this time we are considering the inclusion of several smaller changes: 

- tweaks to the handshake protocol for improved DoS resistance
- support for NAT hole punching

author: .fjl
content: I'm still working on larger protocol changes for topic-based discovery, but I think it's better to start with a smaller upgrade.

author: .fjl
content: Specifically because there haven't been any protocol version upgrades on discv5 yet

author: .fjl
content: Seems easier and safer to test out the upgrade flow with a smaller set of changes

author: .fjl
content: If you guys want, we could also explore adding support for ed25519 node identities in this version. But it's not strictly required...

author: .fjl
content: Here is the tracking issue for Discovery v5.2: https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/issues/226

author: pipermerriam
content: <@194432762315407360> what's your appetite like for a protocol-native UTP-like solution for data transfer above the single packet size?

author: .fjl
content: I'm working on a proposal for this problem!

author: pipermerriam
content: I suspect we'd love to part of the discussion so please let us know as soon as you've got anything we can look over.
